Issues.Title: test: make expanding_rows test work in g3
Issues.Body:
This PR modifies the `expanding_rows` test so that it works in g3.

1. `index,ts` must be named `index_aot.ts`
2. Scripts should be loaded via `ts_devserver` and not as an explicit
script tag in the HTML.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): capture template source mapping details during preanalysis
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, the template source mapping details were always
built during the analysis phase, under the assumption that pre-analysed
templates would always correspond with external templates. This has
turned out to be a false assumption, as inline templates are also
pre-analyzed to be able to preload any stylesheets included in the
template.

This commit fixes the bug by capturing the template source mapping
details at the moment the template is parsed, which is either during the
preanalysis phase when preloading is available, or during the analysis
phase when preloading is not supported.

Tests have been added to exercise the template error mapping in
asynchronous compilations where preloading is enabled, similar to how
the CLI performs compilations.

Fixes #32538
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): capture template source mapping details during preanalysis" (#32544)

Issues.Title: Language Service: Provide error on invalid templateUrls
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for @angular/tools-language-service


### Description

The language service should provide an error whenever a user types an invalid `templateUrl` or `styleUrl`. In VSCode for instance, this will be displayed as a red squiggly.

```typescript
@Component({
  templateUrl: 'badTemplate.ht',
                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
})
```

### Describe the solution you'd like

Update [language-service/diagnostics](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/language-service/src/diagnostics.ts).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): run tree benchmark with bundles and ngDevMode off
Issues.Body: Before this change the tree benchmark was running with the un-bundled version, without `ngDevMode` tree-shaken away. This was very slow setup for ngIvy as we were essentially running in the dev mode.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(ivy): run tree benchmark with bundles and ngDevMode off" (#32558)

Issues.Title: canDeactive firing AFTER lazy loading of route even if navigation is not allowed to occur
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Have tested 8.1.3 and 6.1.10 ### Is this a regression? No, is acting the same in V6 and V8 ### Description When going to a lazy loaded route from a route with a `canDeactivate` route guard, before the `canDeactivate` would prevent navigation, the lazy loading happens and the chunk is downloaded causing the `RouteConfigLoadStart` and `RouteConfigLoadEnd` events to fire. These events should only occur if the `canDeactivate` returns true. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Check console output. Navigate to module A and then to module B. You will see lazy loading start and then complete before the can deactivate is called [https://angular-can-deactivate-lazy-loading-issue.stackblitz.io/](https://angular-can-deactivate-lazy-loading-issue.stackblitz.io/) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.1.3
Node: 10.16.3
OS: linux x64
Angular:

------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/schematics   8.1.3

Issues.Title: routing using enum and parameter not working on production build
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [x] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No, it's not something regression. ### Description What we want to do is just a smart way to define routes and make it easy to maintenance, for example, changing the paths, and implementing on HTML with pre-defined enums or constants. All working well, but if we use this way with a parameter, it doesn't work on production mode. We are thinking this is limitation of AOT compiler to Javascript syntax, but that document doesn't give any idea about this issue. We would like to report this issue to `angular-cli` repository, guessing this is related with the compiler. Thank you. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Define `enum/const`s for routing example ``` export const ROOT = 'contacts', PEOPLE = 'people', OFFICES = 'offices'; ``` 2. Use defined values for routes ``` { path: RouterMap.Contacts.PEOPLE, components: PeopleComponent }, { path: RouterMap.Contacts.PEOPLE + '/:id', component: PersonComponent }, ``` 3. Check `/people/{person_id}` on brower (local). All works fine 4. After compiling **AOT** this routing won't work. It is maybe being translated into ``` path: '[Object]' + '/:id' ``` 5. Is related with [the AOT Limitation](https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#expression-syntax-limitations), (but it doesn't make sense) ## üî• Exception or Error No error or exceptions, just defined routing is not working on production. ## üåç Your Environment

Hello, i would like to know if could be possible to customize angular component on my business need. sometimes we repeat a lot of common behaviours in some components.

e.g : form component that will manage the form behind the scence.
we know already that this component will start with form validation and display errors if necessary.
and most of time we have 2 buttons one for submit and the other for reset.
and finally it's will end up with success or fail message.

could it be possible to create or customize a component that could do all this stuff behind the scence and the developer could only focus on submit method that should be create to route with service call.

Issues.Title: ‚ÄúStaticInjectorError: No provider for Injector‚Äù When building angular app using bazel
Issues.Body:
I'm currently trying to convert an angular project from using angular cli to bazel. I'm trying to follow the configuration in the angular-bazel-example repo (https://github.com/angular/angular-bazel-example) as closely as possible, the main difference is that the project resides in a subdirectory of the workspace, as there are other projects in this workspace as well. The ng_module, as well as the rollup_bundle rules go through fine, however when trying to run the app (provided by an express server) I get the error "StaticInjectorError(AppModule)[HttpHandler -> Injector]: No provider for Injector"

Before getting this error I got the same error for some services in the project itself as well, that I could get rid of (I think) by using the INJECTOR injection token instead.

Googling the error mostly yielded results where symlinked libraries were causing the issue, which I feel is not unlikely the issue here as well, as bazel uses symlinks alot, however the proposed solution of setting preserveSymlinks to true in the angular.jsons build options is not an option here, as angular.json is not used when compiling using bazel.
I have tried setting preserve symlinks everywhere I could, including the yarn_install rule and the node_repositories rule, but this did not have any effects.

As in the angular-bazel-example repo, the angular modules are built at the postinstall script, which I feel might be an issue, however not building them there results in errors during the projects angular compilation.

The only point where the Injector is used in the @angular/common/http package is here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/http/src/module.ts#L34 so I guess this is where the error is thrown.

Files that might be of interest:

tsconfig
```json
{
  "extends": "../tsconfig.json",
  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
    "module": "es2015",
    "baseUrl": "",
    "types": [],
    "paths": {
      "protos/*": [
        "../../../bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/core/client/src/protos/*"
      ]
    }
  },
  "exclude": [
    "test.ts",
    "**/*.spec.ts"
  ]
}
```

tsconfig for angular packages
```json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "lib": [
            "dom",
            "es2015"
        ],
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "types": [],
        "module": "amd",
        "moduleResolution": "node"
    },
    "angularCompilerOptions": {
        "enableSummariesForJit": true
    },
    "include": [
        "node_modules/@angular/**/*",
        "node_modules/@ngrx/**/*",
        "node_modules/ngx-pagination/**/*",
        "node_modules/ng2-completer/**/*",

# Make TypeScript and Angular compilation fast, by keeping a few copies of the
# compiler running as daemons, and cache SourceFile AST's to reduce parse time.
build --strategy=TypeScriptCompile=worker
build --strategy=AngularTemplateCompile=worker

# Don't create bazel-* symlinks in the WORKSPACE directory.
# These require .gitignore and may scare users.
# Also, it's a workaround for https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/issues/12
# which affects the common case of having `tsconfig.json` in the WORKSPACE directory.
#
# Instead, you should run `bazel info bazel-bin` to find out where the outputs went.
build --symlink_prefix=dist/

test --test_output=errors

# Use the Angular 6 compiler
build --define=compile=legacy

# Turn off legacy external runfiles
run --nolegacy_external_runfiles
test --nolegacy_external_runfiles

try-import .bazelrc.user

```

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): match class and attribute value without case-sensitivity
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

Prior to this commit, a directive with a selector `selector=".Titledir"` would not match an element like `div class="titleDir"` in Ivy whereas it would in VE. The same issue was present for `selector="[title=Titledir]` and `title="titleDir"`.  

## What is the new behavior?

This fixes the Ivy behavior by changing the matching algorithm to use lowercased values.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

(well it can if someone was relying on Ivy behaving differently than VE, but I don't think it is the case).

## Other information

Note that some `render3` tests needed to be changed to reflect that the compiler generates lowercase selectors. These tests are in the process to be migrated to `acceptance` to use `TestBed` in another PR anyway.

Issues.Title: Failed to list lazy routes: Unknown module ‚Äì‚Äì INCL. REPRO
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

Updatimg from 9.0.0-next.2 to 9.0.0-next.4

```
    "@angular/animations": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/common": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/compiler": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/core": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/elements": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/forms": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "9.0.0-next.4",
    "@angular/router": "9.0.0-next.4",
```


### Is this a regression?

Chances are: no.


### Description

ng build fails with:

```
ERROR in Failed to list lazy routes: Unknown module '<...>/pong/src/app/app.module#AppModule'.
```



## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Code: https://github.com/sparkles-dev/sparkles/pull/533

Build logs: https://circleci.com/gh/sparkles-dev/sparkles/3892?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-build-link

#### Application

```ts
@NgModule({
  declarations: [AppComponent, PlayComponent],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    RouterModule.forRoot([
      /* intentionally empty routes array */
    ], { initialNavigation: 'enabled', useHash: true }),
    ReframedModule.forGuest([
      /* routes array */
      { path: 'play-it-now', component: PlayComponent }
    ])
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule {}
```

#### Library

```ts
import { RouterModule, provideRoutes } from '@angular/router';

export interface Entry {
  path: string;
  component: Type<any>;
}

export const ENTRIES = new InjectionToken<Entry[]>('@sparkles/reframed: Entry[]');

export function provideEntries(entries: Entry[]): ValueProvider[] {
  return [
    {
      provide: ANALYZE_FOR_ENTRY_COMPONENTS,
      multi: true,
      useValue: entries
    },
    {
      provide: ENTRIES,
      useValue: entries
    }
  ];
}


@NgModule({
  imports: []
})
export class ReframedModule {

  public static forGuest(entries: Entry[], resolverOptions?: ReframedOptions): ModuleWithProviders {
    const guestProviders = [
      ...provideEntries(entries),
      ...provideRoutes([
        {
          path: 'external',
          children: [
            { path: '**', component: GuestComponent }
          ]
        }
      ])
    ];

    return {
      ngModule: ReframedGuestModule,
      providers: guestProviders
    };
  }
}
```

#### How It Worked (before <= next.2)

The lib `ReframedModule` would use `provideRoutes` from `@angular/router` to hook a route definition into an app. It would then use `ANALYZE_FOR_ENTRY_COMPONENTS` from `@angular/core` to add dynamic components to an app.

At app runtime, the module would use the `external/**` route definition to pick a dynamic component and render it for a wildcard route. For example, `#/external/play-it-now` would result in `GuestComponent` being rendered (for the wildcard route), which in turn would pick up `PlayComponent` from the dynamic components API and render it to screen (via `ComponentFactoryResolver` and friends).


## üî• Exception or Error

see above. Detailed error from build logs:

$ ng build reframed-pong

10% building 0/0 modules 0 active

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): create StaticReflector once only
Issues.Body:
The creation of `StaticReflector` in `createMetadataResolver()` is a very expensive operation because it involves numerous module resolutions (on the order of hundreds) to initialize core Angular symbols.
Since the API of the Reflector does not provide the ability to invalidate its internal caches, `StaticReflector` has to be destroyed and recreated on *every* program change.
This has a HUGE impact on performance.
This PR fixes this problem by carefully invalidating all StaticSymbols in a file that has changed, thereby greatly reducing the overhead of recomputation on program change.

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): use a type guard to get rid of casts
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Not utilizing TypeScript's features which the code would benefit from.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

When we use a guard, TypeScript infers the type in `if`s correctly. Thus, we can remove this mess of casts and parenthesis:

```
  const validator =
      (isOptionsObj(validatorOrOpts) ? (validatorOrOpts as AbstractControlOptions).validators :
                                       validatorOrOpts) as ValidatorFn |
      ValidatorFn[] | null;
```

and simply write:

```
  const validator = isOptionsObj(validatorOrOpts) ? validatorOrOpts.validators : validatorOrOpts;
```

All this by simply changing the return type of `isOptionsObj` from `boolean` to `validatorOrOpts is AbstractControlOptions`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

This has nothing to do with a popular request to strongly type the forms. It's just internal refactoring.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(forms): use a type guard to get rid of casts" (#32541)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): consistently use outer declaration for classes
Issues.Body:
In ngcc's reflection hosts for compiled JS bundles, such as ESM2015,
special care needs to be taken for classes as there may be an outer
declaration (referred to as "declaration") and an inner declaration
(referred to as "implementation") for a given class. Therefore, there
will also be two `ts.Symbol`s bound per class, and ngcc needs to switch
between those declarations and symbols depending on where certain
information can be found.

Prior to this commit, the `NgccReflectionHost` interface had methods
`getClassSymbol` and `findClassSymbols` that would return a `ts.Symbol`.
These class symbols would be used to kick off compilation of components
using ngtsc, so it is important for these symbols to correspond with the
publicly visible outer declaration of the class. However, the ESM2015
reflection host used to return the `ts.Symbol` for the inner
declaration, if the class was declared as follows:

```javascript
var MyClass = class MyClass {};
```

For the above code, `Esm2015ReflectionHost.getClassSymbol` would return
the `ts.Symbol` corresponding with the `class MyClass {}` declaration,
whereas it should have corresponded with the `var MyClass` declaration.
As a consequence, no `NgModule` could be resolved for the component, so
no components/directives would be in scope for the component. This
resulted in errors during runtime.

This commit resolves the issue by introducing a `NgccClassSymbol` that
contains references to both the outer and inner `ts.Symbol`, instead of
just a single `ts.Symbol`. This avoids the unclarity of whether a
`ts.Symbol` corresponds with the outer or inner declaration.

More details can be found here: https://hackmd.io/7nkgWOFWQlSRAuIW_8KPPw

Fixes #32078
Closes FW-1507

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): minimal=true should not create tests files when using `ng generate` command
Issues.Body:
Before this commit:
`--minimal=true` create project without any testing frameworks and disable e2e, lint, test targets. Thereafter, if in this minimal project we try command `ng generate class|component|directive|guard|module|pipe|service`, it will always create `*_spec.ts` files.

After this commit:
`--minimal=true` override `@schematics/angular` in `angular.json` to not create `*_spec.ts` files when using `ng generate *` commands.

Issues.Title: Registering lazy routes (dynamic import) at runtime
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
With the [string loadChildren syntax deprecated](https://angular.io/api/router/DeprecatedLoadChildren) in Angular 8, in favor of the [dynamic import syntax](https://angular.io/api/router/LoadChildrenCallback), it seems it will no longer be possible to register lazy routes at runtime.

Please note that by adding lazy routes at runtime, I'm not referring to loading modules completely unknown to Webpack. These modules would be part of libs that are compiled together with the application, so the chunks would be known to Webpack, but routes would only be added to the router config as a result of a Web API call.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Basically, I'd like to be able to do the following (from a component or e.g. a ngrx effect), and successfully navigate to the new route and its children, while using JIT, AOT and with Ivy (AOT):

```javascript
this._router.config.unshift({
  path: 'dynamic',
  loadChildren: () => import(modulePathReceivedFromServer).then(m => m[moduleNameReceivedFromServer])
});
this._router.resetConfig(this._router.config);
```

With dynamic imports working this way, one could also easily load lazy modules on demand/without routing to them (currently possible with the [deprecated SystemJsNgModuleLoader](https://angular.io/api/core/SystemJsNgModuleLoader)).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only alternative I can think of is a Webpack plugin doing something similar to what the `AngularCompilerPlugin` does in `contextModuleFactory.afterResolve`.
You can see my detailed analysis, with a simple demo app and the solutions I could think of here: https://github.com/mbinic/dynamic-lazy-routes#dynamic-lazy-routes-experiment. The last few commits show the code using JIT, AOT and Ivy (AOT), route adding code being almost identical for all cases.

Constructive criticism from the experts is the best way to learn, so I'd love to get your input even if you think this is a bad idea or just plain nonsense. And I'd gladly make a PR if this is something you'd support, to angular-cli and webpack :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Registering lazy routes (dynamic import) at runtime" (#15556)

Issues.Title: build: update terser to version 4.3.1
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [terser](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser) | dependencies | minor | [`4.2.1` -> `4.3.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/terser/4.2.1/4.3.1) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>fabiosantoscode/terser</summary>

### [`v4.3.1`](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v431)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/compare/v4.3.0...v4.3.1)

-   Fixed an issue from 4.3.0 where any block scope within a for loop erroneously had its parent set to the function scopee
-   Fixed an issue where compressing IIFEs with argument expansions would result in some parameters becoming undefined
-   addEventListener options argument's properties are now part of the DOM properties list.

### [`v4.3.0`](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v430)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/compare/v4.2.1...v4.3.0)

-   Do not drop computed object keys with side effects
-   Functions passed to other functions in calls are now wrapped in parentheses by default, which speeds up loading most modules
-   Objects with computed properties are now less likely to be hoisted
-   Speed and memory efficiency optimizations
-   Fixed scoping issues with `try` and `switch`

</details>

Issues.Title: Enable extension of #/definitions/project & #/definitions/target
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
...
- [x] run
...
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Hi folks,
first of all, great Job with the whole CLI & Architect project. A lot of great capabitilies :raised_hands:. 
Some background:
Since three weeks I'm working currently on something to enable the [micro frontends](https://martinfowler.com/articles/micro-frontends.html) approach with angular. 
The first two weeks I spent with evaluating in how this is even possible together with angular:
 _Besides @angular/elements, I have the feeling that web components were never really the focus for the angular team, right?...._
 _**But!!!**..... it works. There are some pitfalls and little details, but all in all, I do have a solution so far, where I'm peacefully happy with to use on a larger environment in enterprise._ 
Some of the things I managed to solve:
- **Share the @angular libraries** between the angular-elements instead of bundling and loading them for each one again.
- **Make use of Ivy for compilation**. This works both for the shared vendor.bundle and for the angular
- **Provide tooling for all of this** (builders, schematics etc.) <-- Spent the third week with

(Yes, I am the one with [2kb angular element](https://twitter.com/simsek_dev/status/1168163228574277639), I'm willing to provide access to the private repo if needed. But I'm not going to make it public right now) 

#### My issue comes with the last point:
On one side, **you provide** great CLI API's for extensions and custom logic, 
but on the other side, **you restrict** people which I don't really get why. 
What I'm talking about is the [json schema for the angular workspace](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json). 
As long as we tinker with builders, everything is okay. But once you need little more than this, things get complicated:
- [This](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json#L396) prevents us from extending the project schema definition
- [This](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json#L398) small WTF
- [This](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json#L402) prevents us to define a custom targets schema

> ### Why though?

**Let's assume** you have one project composited of mutliple subprojects. 
All of the **sub-projects share** some same information, because 
even though they **can be independent** from each other, 
**they do** have some kind of **relation** 
when it comes to that **bigger composition project**.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Just allow additionalProperties? In which way they disturb? :thinking:
A builder may just use those properties he is interested in and ignore all the others.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
So far, that I'm started to code an own angular workspace parser with utilities, because **builder** are allowed to have additionalProperties (WTF!!!). 
And thats the gap I'm using currently to provide some shared information between my angular elements and the container project.

I started to think about using a completely separate custom json for my configuration, which would be sad just because of some flags I'm not getting why they are set.

Kind regards
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable extension of #/definitions/project & #/definitions/target" (#15547)

Issues.Title: ci: update saucelabs protractor config to run e2e tests in series rather than parallel
Issues.Body:
Our combined CI usage is often hitting the max number of concurrent sessions on saucelabs.  Currentl the saucelabs job takes 12 sessions at once because the tests run in parallel, instead we should run these in series to only use 1 session.  

It should not have a large impact on overall CI run time as each of the tests take ~10 seconds so we are moving from the Saucelabs steps taking ~1:45 to ~3:00 each.  Based on previous CI runs it looks like this change will still cause the saucelabs test runs to complete ~15 minutes before other jobs in the sequence.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: update saucelabs protractor config to run e2e tests in series rather than parallel" (#15545)

<details>

Issues.Title: Multiple overlay containers
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I'd like to render certain overlays in a custom container, whereas other overlays should be rendered in the 'default' overlay container.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I've implemented a custom `OverlayContainer` that is provided in the module which also imports the `OverlayModule` to open overlays from a service. This works, all overlays in that module are positioned within the custom overlay container. However, all *other* overlays (such as `mat-select`, `mat-dialog` are also opened in the custom overlay container. I've tried to override the overlay container in the parent module, but then all overlays are positioned within that container. 

Interestingly, snackbars are positioned correctly in the global overlay container, so I think it is possible to have multiple overlay containers, but I just can't find out how to accomplish this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiple overlay containers" (#17024)

Issues.Title: fix: annotate a couple base classes with @Directive for Ivy
Issues.Body:
There are two base classes in Material/CDK which are intended to be extended
by user code: BasePortalHost and MatFormFieldControl.

This commit annotates them with `@Directive`. The best way to do this is to
use `@Directive()` but this is not supported by Angular 8.x, on which
Material and the CDK still depend. Therefore, a workaround is used with a
selector which will never be matched. Modules are also added to satisfy the
View Engine compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: annotate a couple base classes with @Directive for Ivy" (#17022)

Issues.Title: build: fix release scripts not all parsing versions properly
Issues.Body:
Fixes the release scripts not properly parsing versions in the following scenarios:

1) The version has a pre-release version set to `0`. In that case the version pre-release version
  will be ignored.
2) The version has a pre-release version higher than `9`. In that case the Regex for parsing
  the version has an invalid capture group that only matches a single-digit pre-release version.

Thanks to @CaerusKaru for reporting these.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix release scripts not all parsing versions properly" (#17005)

Issues.Title: CDK BreapointObserver emits multiple 'true' for differents sizes of screen
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
Steps to reproduce:
1. Write this code in a service, then subscribe. See in console.
```
isLandscape$: Observable<boolean> = this.breakpointObserver.observe(['(orientation: portrait)', '(orientation: landscape)']).pipe(
    map((result: BreakpointState) => {
      console.log('result', result);
      return result.matches;
    })
  );
screenSizes$: Observable<boolean> = this.breakpointObserver
    .observe([Breakpoints.XSmall, Breakpoints.Small, Breakpoints.Medium, Breakpoints.Large, Breakpoints.XLarge])
    .pipe(
      map((result: BreakpointState) => {
        console.log('result', result);
        return result.matches;
      })
    );
 ```
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

I'm expecting to get only 1 condition set to true for media queries defined in the CDK.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

My browser is 1903px wide. The 1st time i load the page, I see in the console the Large and XLarge conditions set to true: 

```
(min-width: 1280px) and (max-width: 1919.99px): true
(min-width: 1920px): true
```
Then, when I resize my window, this time, the CDK emits only `(min-width: 1280px) and (max-width: 1919.99px): true`.

The same type of error occurs screen when I first get to 'xs' screen by resizing the window: 2 conditions set to true (for Small & XSmall screen sizes):

```
(max-width: 599.99px): true
(min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 959.99px): true
```
Then, when I resize again my window, i only get `(max-width: 599.99px): true`.

ALSO:

When i reload the page in 'xs' size, I get the right values set for both isLandscape & Screen size.
But when i resize the page, I get:
```
breakpoints: {
(orientation: landscape): false
(orientation: portrait): false
}
matches: false
```
I also get a no match from times to times for the screen sizes...

So, that's just not possible.
- The CDK should be able to emit that I'm still in portrait mode, 
- the CDK should be able to detect my screen size any time.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 76
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CDK BreapointObserver emits multiple 'true' for differents sizes of screen" (#17013)

Issues.Title: Make MatBottomSheetRef Constructor Injection Use Case Symmetrical
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The implementation approach for `MatBottomSheetRef` is different and not symmetrical to the implementation approach for other angular components.

For example we have to declare a provider with default values.  Angular could create the default values for us and the implementation could override when necessary.  More here:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57846500/nullinjectorerror-no-provider-for-matbottomsheetref

#### Provide a brief summary of the feature you would like to see.

Defaults provided by angular so that we can we can use `MatBottomSheetRef ` the same way we use all other components / services.

#### Use Case

Describe the use case(s) that the proposed feature would enable.

Just import the `MatBottomSheet` module.  And use the service in the components:

For example if we import it like this:

`import { MatBottomSheetRef } from '@angular/material';`

We get the null injection error.  This does not happen with any other component.

We have to import it like this:

`import { MatBottomSheetRef} from '@angular/material/bottom-sheet';`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make MatBottomSheetRef Constructor Injection Use Case Symmetrical " (#17011)

Issues.Title: feat(material-experimental): add harness for mat-drawer
Issues.Body: Follow-up from #16695. Adds a separate harness for `mat-drawer` and has `mat-sidenav` inherit from it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material-experimental): add harness for mat-drawer" (#17010)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental): use harnesses for mat-option
Issues.Body:
Follow-up from #16620 and #16710. Adds a dedicated harness for `mat-option` and `mat-optgroup`.

Note that some of the code is duplicated. This is because we don't have a shared place where to put the harness so that `mat-autocomplete` and `mat-select` don't have to depend on each other. I've intentionally kept the harnesses to only the methods we need, but once we have `experimental/core`, I'll combine them and implement all of the states that are supported by `mat-option`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental): use harnesses for mat-option" (#17009)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): only clear duplicate containers from different platform
Issues.Body:
Currently we clear all overlay containers when we create a new one as a way to avoid duplicate content coming in from the server. Our current approach is a little too aggressive, because it can pick up containers from different apps. These changes add an extra attribute to the container so that we can determine which platform it's coming from.

Fixes #16851.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(overlay): only clear duplicate containers from different platform" (#17006)

Issues.Title: feat(button): allow setting default button type globally (#15989)
Issues.Body:
Introduces the `MAT_BUTTON_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token, which allows setting the type of the
button element automatically.
Most browsers set the type attribute to `submit` if omitted, however `button` is usually better
suited as a default value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(button): allow setting default button type globally (#15989)" (#17004)

Issues.Title: feat(tooltip): remove Hammer.js dependency

Reworks the tooltip to remove its dependency on Hammer.js. Also adds an option to disable touch gestures so that text selection doesn't have to be disabled on the trigger.

Fixes #16850.
